intro: Heliophila lactea, commonly known as the milkweed heliophila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. Heliophila lactea is known for its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks.
